benchmark_details.name: UltraLink
benchmark_details.overview: UltraLink is an open-source multilingual supervised fine-tuning dataset comprising approximately 1 million samples across five languages. It employs a knowledge-grounded data augmentation approach and a two-stage translation mechanism to improve the multilingual abilities of large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct a comprehensive multilingual supervised fine-tuning dataset that enhances the language-specific and language-agnostic capabilities of large language models.

data.source: Constructed from knowledge-grounded methods and existing English SFT datasets, augmented with multilingual capabilities.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using templates and language models.

methodology.calculation: Average performance scores across various multilingual tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect the multilingual capabilities of the trained models on fine-tuned datasets.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures were based on performance across several representative multilingual benchmarks.
